snippet: Latrice Rocha's eyes seemed to grow as big as grapefruits.    ''Look,'' she said, turning to her sister, Angelina, and holding up a six-pack of athletic socks for $4. ''In the mall, these would cost at least $10.99, plus tax. That's a huge differe...
lead_paragraph: Latrice Rocha's eyes seemed to grow as big as grapefruits. ''Look,'' she said, turning to her sister, Angelina, and holding up a six-pack of athletic socks for $4. ''In the mall, these would cost at least $10.99, plus tax. That's a huge difference. And here maybe they don't charge me the tax.''
abstract: Some Southern Californians, including many new immigrants, fight high living costs by doing all their shopping at swap meets, huge open-air flea markets; more than 100 such markets open each year; photos (M)

headline.main: Ontario Journal; At California 'Swap Meet,' $1 Goes a Long Way
